result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikola Stevlic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Nikola Stevlic was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nikola Stevlic is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Nikola Stevlic was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Nikola Stevlic was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Nikola Stevlic was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Nikola Stevlic was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Nikola Stevlic was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Nikola Stevlic was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Nikola Stevlic was found guilty of Expose Child to Harmful Descriptions, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED TO COURT COSTS AND DNA. PAID IN FULL.

No contact with victim, residence or place of employment.
No contact with minor child, Z.S., without the approval of N.S., or Z.S's therapist and the Agent of record.
Compliance with Sex Offender Registration Program.
Compliance with DNA testing.
Cooperate, attend and participate in all treatment programs recommended by Agent, including: AODA treatment, Sex Offender Treatment, Anger Management and/or Domestic Violence Counseling.
No possession of any pornographic and/or secually explicit materials.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drugs screens.
Not to use medications without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Obtain and maintain a stable residence approved by the Dept. of Corrections.
Pay all supervision fees.
Comply with any other conditions imposed by Agent.

ADDRESS INFO for Nikola Stevlic
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail,   (Effective: 12-08-2016)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Alternate juror selected for case

Defendant Nikola Stevlic in court with attorney Peter M Wolff and Zachary Hoff.  Michael Thurston and Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case called for day 3 of trial.  Jury enters courtroom at 8:36.  Nikola Stevlic sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the defense.  Court takes a short recess at 10:31.  

Court reconvenes at 10:45.  Nikola Stevlic continues testimony on behalf of the defense.  Cross-examination by the State.  Jury excused at 12:05.  Court breaks for lunch.  

Court reconvenes at 1:15.  Court goes over verdict forms and jury instructions with the parties as to any changes.  It was brought to the court's attention that there was some contact between the victim's father and one of the jurors.  Court addressed the contact.  Defendant's father sworn in and questioned by the court.  Court is satisfied based on the testimony provided that contact did not taint the juror.  Jury recalled at 1:44.  Re-direct of Nikola Stevlic by defense.  Defense rests.

State recalls Lieutenant Schmidt as a rebuttal witness and gives testimony.  Cross-examination by the defense.  Re-direct by State.  State rests.  Jury excused at 2:03.  

Court reconvenes at 2:23.  Court addresses final changes to jury instructions.  Jury recalled at 2:24.  Court gives jury instructions to jurors.  State presents closing arguments.  Defense presents closing arguments.  State presents final arguments.  Court gives final instructions to the jurors.  Judge announces alternate juror and excuses him.  Clerk swears in bailiff.  Jurors leave courtroom for deliberations at 4:03.  Jurors have question at 4:34.  Court has counsel return and recalls case at 4:40.  Jurors request admitted photos and documents.  Court grants request and admitted photos and documents are sent back to the jury room at 4:45.  Jurors have question at 5:21.  Court has counsel return and recalls case at 5:23.  Jurors have questions regarding jury instructions.  Parties present arguments.  Court sends response back to jurors at 5:43.  

Jury has reached a verdict at 6:06.  Jury enters courtroom at 6:11.  Jury finds the defendant guilty as to Counts 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8.  Jury finds defendant not guilty as to Count 3.  Jury is released at 6:14.  State moves for entry of judgment of conviction on counts 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8.  Defense objects.  Court grants request.  Defense requests a pre-sentence investigation.  State objects.  Court grants.  Court orders bail revoked and defendant is remanded to custody forthwith.  Court sets sentencing date.

Defendant Nikola Stevlic in court with attorneys Peter M Wolff and Zachary Wolff.  Michael Thurston and Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case called for day 2 of trial.  Jury enters courtroom at 8:33.  Witness Nicole S. continues testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibit 62, marked and received.  Court takes a short recess at 9:25.  

Court reconvenes and jury is recalled at 9:38.  Witness Nicole S. continues testimony on behalf of the State.  Defense reserves the right to recall witness as part of defense's case.  Witness Elizabeth E. sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibit 53, marked and received.  Cross-examination by defense.  

Witness Justin O. sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibit 54, marked and received.  No Cross-examination by defense.  

Witness James Phillips of Town of Brookfield Fire Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  No Cross-examination by defense.  

Witness Lieutenant Sean Schmidt of Town of Brookfield Police Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  Cross-examination by defense.  Defense presents Exhibit 64, marked and received.  Re-direct by State.  Re-cross by defense.  Court breaks for lunch at 11:23.

Court reconvenes and jury is recalled at 1:29.  Expert witness Latrice Hogan sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibits 55 and 56, marked and received.  Cross-examination by defense.  State rests.  Jury excused at 2:05.  

Defense moves for directed verdict on all counts.  State makes arguments.  Court denies motion for directed verdict.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant and Attorney Wolff regarding defendant's testimony.  Parties stipulate as to defendant's two prior convictions.  Court takes a short recess at 2:11.

Court reconvenes and jury is recalled at 2:19.  Witness Nicole S. recalled and gives testimony on behalf of the Defense.  Defense presents Exhibits 65, 66, 67 and 68, marked and received.  Cross-examination by State.  State presents Exhibit 57, marked and received.  Re-direct by defense.  Jurors excused at 3:55 and ordered to return at 8:30 tomorrow.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir dire list alphabetical and random listing report.

Defendant Nikola Stevlic in court with attorneys Peter M Wolff and Zachary Hoff.  Michael Thurston and Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of Amended Information and enters not guilty plea on all counts.  Court addresses defendant's Motions in Limine.  State does not object.  Court grants defendant's Motions in Limine.  Court addresses defendant's previous convictions.  Parties make arguments.  Court will allow two convictions if the defendant testifies.

35 potential jurors sworn in.  Court conducts voir dire.  Court strikes juror #3 for cause.  New juror called.  Court strikes juror #9 for cause.  New juror called.  

Voir dire by Attorney Thurston.  Voir dire by Attorney Wolff.  Court strikes juror #10 and #23 for cause.  Two new jurors called.  Parties conduct peremptory challenges.  Court further instructs jurors.  Clerk announces 13 selected jurors (1 alternate).  Remaining jurors dismissed at 10:55 a.m.  Clerk swears in 13 selected jurors to try the issue.  

Opening statements by Attorney Thurston.  Opening statements by Attorney Wolff.  Molly F. sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4, and 8, marked and received.   Cross-examination by defense.  Re-direct by State.  State presents Exhibit 15, marked and received.  Re-cross by defense.  Court breaks for lunch at 12:10 p.m.  Court reconvenes at 1:19 p.m.

Officer Paul Schmitt of Town of Brookfield Police Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibits 9, 10, 58 and 59, marked and received.  Exhibits 9, 10, 58 and 59 are published to the jury.  Cross-examination by defense.  Defense presents Exhibit 60, marked and received.  Re-direct by State. 

Detective Shari Janke of Waukesha County Sheriff's Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibit 5, 6 and 7, marked and received.  No cross-examination by defense. 

Detective Margaret Herrmann of Waukesha County Sheriff's Department sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibits 11, 12, 13, 14, 16 through 41, 48 and 61 marked and received.  Cross-examination by defense.  State reserves the right to recall witness Hermann.  Court takes a short recess at 2:50.  

Court reconvenes at 3:02. Witness Nicole S. sworn in and gives testimony on behalf of the State.  State presents Exhibits 42 through 47, 49, 50, 51 and 52, marked and received.  Jurors excused at 4:52 and ordered to return at 8:30 tomorrow.
trial motions

Defendant Nikola Stevlic in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are ready to proceed to trial.  Defense does not object to the State's Motions in Limine.  Court grants State's Motions in Limine.  State moves to exclude inflammatory text and text images from defendant's phone.  Defense does not object.  Court will not rule until issue is raised at trial.  State will be raising prior bad acts at the trial.  Prior conviction issues to be addressed at trial.  Parties allowed 4 strikes each.  This will be the #1 trial.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
